Player History
Won Gold Glove Award at Second Base in 1965...
Won Gold Glove Award at Second Base in 1966...
Signed as a free agent by California on 2/4/1967 to a 2-year deal worth $1,234,567 per year...
Injured on 8/16/1967 with a Strained Back, out for 1-2 weeks...
Had 5 hits with 3 RBI against Detroit on 7/8/1968...
Injured on 8/13/1968 with a Ruptured Tricep Tendon, out for 4 weeks...
Signed as a free agent by Cleveland on 7/14/1969 to a minor league deal...
Drafted in 1st round, 20th overall pick, by Los Angeles in 1972...
Traded from Los Angeles to Philadelphia on 6/23/1975 (Going to LA: P H. Shank. Going to PHI: LF G. Richards, 2B L. Whitaker, P L. Andersen)...
Earned first career win on 6/27/1977...
Injured on 4/9/1979 with a Tight Shoulder, out for 1-2 weeks...
Won World Series with Philadelphia in 1984...
Signed as a free agent by Cleveland on 2/3/1985 to a 4-year deal worth $4,020,000 per year...
Was selected to the 1987 Allstar game...
